conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, interior volume reads as spatial rooms, and the view is an angled/isometric perspective with the roof/ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clean corners and readable room volumes; angled camera is appropriate; minor simplification/flatness in some interior wall-top detailing but overall clearly 3D.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout closely matches the 2D plan: living room, kitchen/nook, dining, study, hall, utility, bedrooms, master suite, baths, garage, and covered patio areas are present with largely correct adjacencies. Some openings (doors/windows) appear simplified and not all placements/sizes can be confirmed as exact.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen counters/appliances and bathroom fixtures are modeled; some seating appears, but bedrooms are largely unfurnished (missing beds/major bedroom furniture), reducing room-identity confidence.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with good lighting and clear separation of walls/floors/openings. Text labels on the floor plan within the 3D view reduce presentation cleanliness.

detected_errors.description: Some door/window placements and/or opening proportions appear simplified compared to the 2D plan, though overall positions are broadly consistent.
Bedrooms lack key furniture (e.g., beds), and some rooms have minimal furnishings, reducing fidelity of interior element translation.
Text labels are present inside the 3D render, lowering presentation/background cleanliness per rubric.

summary: A clear, true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall plan fidelity, with minor simplifications in openings and incomplete furniture detailing.
